intro: Dendrobium gedeanum, commonly known as the Borneo orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the rainforests of Borneo. It is characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and relies on mycorrhizal associations for nutrient uptake. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing structural support and efficient water retention. Dendrobium gedeanum is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
